data.title: If looking for a menu catering towards burgers & fries, it's here!
data.text: Group from work met for lunch here; highly recommended was the $4 "Small" burger and the chicken sandwich with Ghost Pepper cheese (a must only if you REALLY like spicy cheese).  The fries are okay, but the real star are the fried mushrooms and fried pickles with their house-made ranch (on the zesty side). Meals are a la carte so the sides are priced separately, and the beer list includes lots of local craft variety (including LogBoat in town). We had a group of nine so our wait was a bit lengthy, but they refilled our drinks and the atmosphere wasn't too loud (with so many tvs) so we were comfortable and chatted during the wait.  There were several families with kids there and the staff were friendly.

data.title: Best hamburger and craft beer selection on the cheap
data.text: Order the $5 cheeseburger and craft beer for a great afternoon.  Craft beer selection feature local brewers.  Order the fried pickles for a different side.

data.title: Professional run , Bar, Food, pool establishment
data.text:
The food was inexpensive (by my Northeastern standards, large quantities and tasty.  Chicken, hamburgers , fries , with loving attention to spices and cheeses.

The pool tables are well kept and cheap.  We paid about 5 dollars for 3 games of 8 ball.  Plenty of wide screen TV's to watch any sporting event

It seems to me the owner makes sure , underage drinkers get carded, so there is an older crowd at the establishment.

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: I have lived in Columbia for 8 years and eat out 5-6 nights a week.  Never considered going here for food but read that they had good burgers so decided to give it a try.  Glad I went because their burgers were awesome.  Fries were ok but the burgers were worth the visit.

data.title: Best Burgers
data.text: Billiards really does have the best burgers in Columbia. There is nothing special about the place itself but the food is always hot, fresh and good.

data.title: Another excellent choice for a burger in Columbia with the addition of "Hand Cut Fries"!
data.text: Columbia is lucky to have a number of great choices for tasty burgers. This one adds one of the best places for fresh "hand-cut french fries"! Tasty as Mom used to make for us 50 years ago. While not always a crispy as I'd like the flavor tops everything. Good pool hall atmosphere and friendly weight staff. Excellent beer choices with many local craft beers on the list.

data.title: Favorite place for hamburgers
data.text: Billiards has wonderful bar-style food; I like spicy food and the Roommate is one of my favorite burgers.  They also have good french fries.  My wife and I eat here whenever we're in the mood for just a burger and maybe an appetizer.  They also have a lot of big screen tvs so it's a good place to catch a game.  We watched the SEC Championship here a few years ago and it was a full house.

data.title: best hamburgers
data.text: One of the best hamburgers you will ever eat. Great fries. Real good chili fries. Great selection of draft beer. Mostly great bar food. Good prices.

data.title: Didn't eat here just played billards
data.text: atmosphere was great, billards by the hour on professional pool tables.  Didn't eat here just played pool, although the food I saw being served looked like your standard bar fare. Good selection of craft beers.

data.title: Best Hamburger in town!
data.text:
I know the masses will argue that Booches it the best.  It is pretty good, if you don't mind the "chips, no fries" Billy Goat Tavern spiel.  However, venture down on Broadway to try the burgers at Billiards.  They are far more tasty, much larger portions and their hand-cut fries are DELISH.  

If i had $10 to spend for lunch and had to buy a burger... I'd pick Billiards over Booches.

data.title: Good burger joint
data.text: Me and my coworkers have eaten here several times. The burgers are always good and who doesn't like fresh cut fries.  The fries are crispy, tasty and plentiful. The service is usually good but sometimes a little slow.

data.title: one of the best burgers in town
data.text: Friendly establishment on Columbia's main street that serves delicious burgers (hand patted, not pre-pounded hockey pucks), an excellent assortment of craft beers (including several local options), and has ~20 pool tables.

data.title: Don't forget the fries!
data.text: We went to BB for our second New Years eve in a row.  The atmosphere there is relaxed and the food is good, especially for bar food.  Burgers and fries are made fresh to order and they even make their own fries!  Their burgers are pretty good and even if you aren't a vegetarian, I would suggest the veggie burger (add bacon!). Pool table prices have gone up in the last year, but it is still a great place to meet up and hang out with friends since the music isn't up too loud for conversation and their aren't a lot of college kids getting wasted (it is located near Missouri University). Service can be slow, but they are usually minimally staffed, so don't go in for a quick in and out.

data.title: Great Burger
data.text: Visiting daughter at como and stopped into Billiards for a meal.  Ordered a burger and jalapeno pepper rings.  Food was great!  A little slow in wait service but very crowded due to the World Cup Soccer being shown there. Great food for a reasonable price with local flair.
